newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Davids sees big expansion into Asia.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Davids sees big expansion into Asia.

text.p: Australian grocery retailer and wholesaler Davids Ltd said it expected to have an Asian business presence which would be double the size of its local business in the next 10 years.
"I would say it would be about double the size of our Australian business," joint managing director John Patten told reporters after the company's annual meeting.
Davids Ltd currently has no Asian operations but has an option to acquire the Southeast Asian activities operated by the David family, which owns about 41.5 percent of Davids.
Davids director Jim Fleming said: "The board is very bullish on Asia."
Davids chairman John David said earlier that he expected the company to report sales of about A$8.00 billion in 1996/97.
Davids achieved an 11.9 percent rise in 1995/96 (July-June) net profit to A$51.8 million from A$46.3 million a year earlier.
Davids shares closed one cent up at A$1.83.
